Class AbstractLCSDiff<C,E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • istory.AbstractLCSDiff<C,E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Diff<C>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LCSCharSequenceDiff, LCSCollectionDiff, LCSSortedMapDiff

    public abstract class AbstractLCSDiff<C,E>
extends Object
implements Diff<C>
    Diff based on LCS algorithm. Inspired from http://www.bioalgorithms.info/downloads/code/LCS.java
    Author:
    Cedric Chantepie

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  AbstractLCSDiff.Change<C,E>
      Change from lcs, to original or destination, at specified index range.
      class  AbstractLCSDiff.Changeable<C,E>
      Changeable value we can work with to apply determined changes.
      protected class  AbstractLCSDiff.CommonElement<T>
      Element present in both original and destination.

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      private static int LEFT
      Go left in the backtracking

      Do not move
      protected ArrayList<AbstractLCSDiff.Change<C,E>> removed

        Parameters:

        See Also:

      • processLcs

        protected void processLcs(C original,
              C destination)
        Process original and destination in order to obtain the longest common subsequence between these two. This is needed to be able to determine changes for original and destination (processDifferences), and so is needed to patch and revert.
        See Also:
        processDifferences(C, C), patch(V), revert(V)

      • createChange

        protected abstract AbstractLCSDiff.Change<C,E> createChange(C container,
                                       org.apache.commons.lang3.Range<Integer> range)
        Create a change instance.
        Parameters:
        container -
        range - Initial change range

      • processDifferences

        protected void processDifferences(C original,
                      C destination)
        Process original and destination according lcs, that must have beeing obtained previously (processLcs), in order to determine changes from lcs to original (removed) and changes from lcs to destination (added). All this is needed to be able to patch and revert
        See Also:
        processLcs(C, C), patch(V), revert(V)
